post_text: This month, twenty-five of our mentees at MECHS participated in a group mentor activity. Students chose a wooden key chain to paint in a creative and artistic way. post_text: Our students had a great time at the Right Path Cafe last night! Students learned the importance of being a lifetime learner. They also learned that not all things come easy but sometimes you just have to make a choice and see where it leads. Students were invited to a unique 3 course meal with the menu in a foreign language (Portuguese). Students ordered 4 items for each course and the items included spaghetti, salad, roll, jello, fork, spoon, knife, toothpick, cheesecake, straw, water and chocolate mint. They could only use the items they ordered to eat that course and then those items were removed for the next course. Several did not have eating utensils for some of the courses. We saw many creative ways to eat dinner! We are proud of these students for finishing classes this fall! Sarah Truelove was the winner of the Right Path Cafe drawing and received movie tickets, snacks and a gift card. Thanks to all our faculty and staff members that helped serve our students at the Right Path Cafe!
